sen.j: 藤原内麻呂の子の藤原真夏の孫にあたる日野家宗が、伝領地である山城国宇治郡日野（京都府京都市伏見区）に弘仁13年（822年）に法家寺を建立して薬師如来の小像を祀った。
sen.e: Iemune Hino, grandson of FUJIWARA no Manatsu who is a child of FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, built Houke-ji Temple in Hino, Uji-County, the Province of Yamashiro (the present Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture) that was a traditional domain of the family in 822, and worshipped a small statue of Yakushinyorai.

sen.e: At the end of the Kamakura period, Suketomo HINO and Toshimoto HINO were punished in Shochu Incident in 1324 and the Genko war in 1332 wherein the conspiracy plan to overthrow the Shogunate by Emperor GODAIGO was revealed.

sen.j: また、室町時代には足利義尚の代まで足利将軍家と結縁し、室町幕府3代征夷大将軍足利義満の室となった日野業子・日野康子（業子の姪）、4代足利義持の室となった日野栄子（康子の実妹）、6代足利義教の室となった日野宗子・日野重子姉妹、8代足利義政の室となった日野富子と4代の将軍の御台所を輩出している。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, until the generation of Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, the House of Hino was related to the House of Ashikaga shogun by marrigage: The House of Hino produced wives of Shogun for four generations including Nariko HINO and Yasuko HINO (niece of Nariko) who bacame wives of the 3rd shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA of the Muromachi Shogunate, Eiko HINO (blood younger sister of Yasuko) who became a wife of the 4th shogun Yoshimotchi ASHIKAGA, sisters of Muneko HINO and Shigeko HINO who became wives of the 6th shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and Tomiko HINO who became a wife of the 8th shogun Yoshimaswa ASHIKAGA.

sen.cmt: Shogun を大文字にしました。Yoshimochi Yoshimasaの スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、その発言力の増大が幕府側の疑心を招き、日野義資が義教により暗殺されて一時没落しかけるが、日野富子は8代将軍足利義政に嫁ぐと、富子の兄の日野勝光も再び政治的影響力を持っていた。

sen.j: 富子は義政の兄弟の足利義視の次期将軍が決まったいたが実子足利義尚の将軍就任を望み実家の日野家も応援し、足利将軍家の家督相続争いが畠山氏や斯波氏の争いと連動して応仁の乱の一因となる。
sen.e: Although it was decided that Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, Yoshimasa's brother, would become the next shogun, Tomiko hoped that her biological child Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA would take the position of the shogun and the House of HINO, Tomiko's parents' home, also backed Yoshihisa, and the battle of the succession to (the headship of) the house in the House of Ashikaga shogun coupled with the conflict between Hatakeyama clan and Shiba clan became a cause of the Onin War.

sen.j: 傍流の日野有光らは南朝復興を目指す後南朝と結んで嘉吉3年（1443年）に京都御所へ乱入し、三種の神器の一部を奪う禁闕の変を起し、有光らは比叡山延暦寺の根本中堂に立て篭もり朝廷から追討令が出ると討たれる。
sen.e: Arimitsu Hino of the side line of the House of Hino tied up with Go-Nancho, Late South Court, that aimed for restoration of the South Court, broke into Kyoto Imperial Palace in 1443, and staged Kinketsu Incident to take the part of the three sacred imperial treasures, and after that Arimitsu and his group locked themselves in Konpon-Chudo hall in Enryaku-ji Temple, Mount Hiei, but they were defeated when the Imperial Court issued an order to hunt down and kill them.
